summary: This document is a series of emails from June 27, 2019, between FBI agents, a Senior Financial Investigator, and AUSAs discussing the ownership history of Jeffrey Epstein's New York mansion at 9 East 71st Street. The emails focus on discrepancies between public reports that Leslie Wexner owned the property and deed records showing Epstein-controlled corporations as the owners from 1989 onward.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: President of Nine East 71st Street Corporation
persons.context: Identified as the president of the corporation that owned the 9 East 71st Street property and as the signatory on the 2011 deed transferring the property to another Epstein entity, Maple Inc.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.context: Mentioned in public reports as having bought the mansion in 1989 and remodeling it, with the property featured as his house in Architectural Digest in 1995, but deed records suggest Epstein's corporation owned it during that period.

connections.description: Potential financial/property ownership relationship where Epstein may have owned the 9 East 71st Street property through a corporation for which he was president, while public reports advertised Wexner as the owner from 1989.

events.title: Purchase of 9 East 71st Street
events.description: The mansion at 9 East 71st Street, New York, was purchased by "Nine East 71st Street Corporation," with public reports indicating Leslie Wexner as the buyer.

events.title: Architectural Digest feature
events.description: The 9 East 71st Street property was featured in Architectural Digest as Leslie Wexner's house.

events.title: Epstein claims ownership to New York Times
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein told the New York Times that the 9 East 71st Street house was his.

events.title: Deed transfer to Maple Inc.
events.description: The last deed of record shows the property at 9 East 71st Street was transferred from Nine East 71st Street Corporation to Maple Inc., a St. Thomas, VI entity, with Jeffrey Epstein signing as both grantor and grantee.

keyFacts: The deed records show that from 1989 to 2012, the property at 9 East 71st Street, New York, was owned by "Nine East 71st Street Corporation," with Jeffrey Epstein as its president.
On December 23, 2011, Epstein signed a deed transferring the property from Nine East 71st Street Corporation to Maple Inc., an entity located in St. Thomas, VI, with no mortgages indicated.
Public reports from 1989 to 1995 advertised Leslie Wexner as the owner and resident of the mansion, creating a discrepancy with the corporate deed records.
The email correspondence involves FBI Squad C-40 (FAST), a Senior Financial Investigator, and AUSAs investigating the property's ownership history as part of a financial investigation.
